p: Light is one of the main factors affecting plant growth and development. Photoreception systems respond to light intensity and quality as well as to light duration and intermittence, thus determining plant morphogenetic changes, functioning of the photosynthetic apparatus, and trend of metabolic pathways [ 130]. Moreover, lighting conditions might evoke the photoxidative changes in plants, which lead to an altered action of the antioxidant defense system [ 130]. Despite the effects of the light irradiance level are well documented, data regarding the effect of light spectral quality in plant metabolism are still limited.
